title: Seven long-distance trains on upcountry line cancelled
byline: Seven long-distance train services on the Upcountry Line have been cancelled tomorrow (21) following the derailment of the Kandy–Colombo Fort intercity express train near Ihala Kotte Railway Station this evening.

title: Adverse weather conditions destroy vegetable plantations in Badulla
byline: Rains coming down in torrents has destroyed vegetable plantations in the Badulla District, it was reported yesterday.

title: Proceeds of Crime Investigation Division to begin operations
byline: The Sri Lanka Police to set up a new unit, Proceeds of Crime Investigation Division (PCID), to investigate property acquired through criminal activities, today.

title: Suspect arrested with over 9kg of Kush
byline: A person has been arrested in the Grandpass area of Colombo for the possession of 9 kilograms and 555 grams of Kush narcotics, police said.

title: EU’s sustainability laws drive Sri Lanka to revives organic farming
byline: Ahead of the European Union’s plans to introduce more sustainability-related laws, Sri Lanka has decided to ramp up measures to promote the organic cultivation of fruits and vegetables targeting the export market, an official said yesterday.

title: Train services on Kelani Valley Line resumes
byline: Train operations on the Kelani Valley Line have returned to normal this morning (20) following yesterday’s derailment between Kosgama and Avissawella railway stations.

title: Two youths run over by lorry during Deepavali celebrations in Talawakelle
byline: Two youths were seriously injured after being run over by a speeding lorry while lighting firecrackers in the centre of Talawakelle town early on Sunday (20), police said.

title: SJB MP Rohana Bandara decides to keep away from party activities
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Rohana Bandara said today that he has decided to keep away from party activities due to an internal issue.

title: Flood warning issued for low-lying areas along Deduru Oya
byline: The Irrigation Department has warned of a possible flood situation in several low-lying areas along the Deduru Oya valley, following considerable rainfall in the upper and middle catchment areas as of 5.00 a.m. today.

title: Online traffic fine payments rolled out in Southern Province
byline: The Police announced that motorists in the Southern Province can now pay spot fines for traffic violations online via the GovPay platform, starting today (20).

title: Bolivia elects centre-right Rodrigo Paz as president
byline: Bolivians have elected Rodrigo Paz of the centre-right Christian Democratic Party (PDC) as their new president, ending almost 20 years of governance by the Movement for Socialism (MAS) party.

title: Govt. still uncertain on KKS Port development under US $ 62 million Indian grant
byline: Despite the offer of over US $ 62 million grant by India, the government has not yet firmed up its decision on the development of the Kankesanthurai Port, an official said yesterday.

title: 30-hour water disruption to hit parts of Galle
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced a 30-hour water cut affecting several areas in the Galle District from 8:00 a.m. today (20).

title: Orionid meteor shower to peak early tonight
byline: The Orionid meteor shower will be visible in Sri Lanka tonight and into the early hours of tomorrow, astronomy experts said.

title: Video of a couple being questioned by Police raises concerns
byline: A video showing a doctor and an engineer being questioned at Panadura Police Station has sparked public outrage and drawn sharp criticism from legal experts.

title: Amazon internet outage hits major websites and mobile apps such as Snapchat. Here’s what we know
byline: Some of the world’s biggest apps and websites, such as Amazon, Google, Snapchat, Roblox, Fortnite, and Canva, have been hit by a major internet outage.

title: Shoppers to pay for plastic bags, containers from Nov. 1
byline: From November 1, shoppers across the country will need to pay for plastic bags and containers at stores, the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) announced, in a move aimed at reducing single-use plastics.

title: Proceeds of Crime Investigation Division launched
byline: A new Proceeds of Crime Investigation Division was inaugurated this morning (20) at the old Police Headquarters in Colombo, under the patronage of Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs Ananda Wijepala.

title: Nandalal Weerasinghe wins “A Grade” in global recognition
byline: Sri Lanka’s Central Bank Governor, Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe, has been awarded the “A Grade” by Global Finance magazine at the 2025 World’s Best Central Bank Governors awards, held alongside the IMF–World Bank Annual Meetings in Washington.

title: Several train services cancelled following landslide on upcountry line
byline: Seven train services, including night mail trains, will be cancelled tonight due to a landslide on the Upcountry railway line, the Railways Department announced.

title: Valvettithurai massacre survivors file USD 15 Mn reparations claim
byline: Survivors and relatives of victims of the 1989 Valvettithurai massacre have submitted a formal reparations claim to the Sri Lankan Office for Reparations, seeking USD 15 million (around LKR 4.5 billion) in compensation for the killings and destruction carried out by the Indian Peace Keeping Force (IPKF) 36 years ago.

title: Digital spot fines for traffic offences launched in Southern Province via GovPay platform
byline: Spot fining for traffic offences in the Southern Province will be implemented through the GovPay digital payment platform starting today, Deputy Inspector General (DIG) W.P.J. Senadeera said.

title: ’I wonder whether I am President Sajith Premadasa’: Sajith
byline: ’’Sometimes I wonder why people come to me with issues they face whereas they have given a mandate to a government to resolve their problems,’’ Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: President seeks swift completion of university degrees
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has called on the Federation of University Teachers’ Associations (FUTA) to develop a comprehensive plan to address delays in university degree programmes and improve the overall functioning of higher education institutions.

title: Four upcountry train services cancelled tomorrow due to adverse weather
byline: Rail services on the Upcountry route will be disrupted tomorrow morning as four trains have been cancelled due to ongoing adverse weather conditions.

title: Zelensky ready to join Trump-Putin talks if invited
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has said he would be ready to join Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin at a proposed summit in Hungary if he were invited.

title: Imported vehicle prices drop in Sri Lanka following Japan price cuts
byline: The prices of imported vehicles in Sri Lanka have dropped by up to Rs. 1.5 million, following a reduction in vehicle prices in Japan, Vehicle Importers Association of Lanka (VIAL) President Indika Sampath Merinchige said.

title: Six students hospitalized, 20 arrested following clash at Ruhuna University
byline: A clash between second- and third-year students was reported at the Faculty of Agriculture, University of Ruhuna, leaving six students hospitalized and 20 others in police custody, authorities said.

title: Nearly Rs. 30 mn traffic spot fines paid through GovPay within two months
byline: Nearly Rs. 30 million has been earned from traffic spot fines paid through the GovPay digital payment platform within two months in the Western Province and the stretch between Dambulla and Anuradhapura, Chairman of the Task Force on Digital Affairs of Transport, Highways and Urban Development Ministry, Harsha Purasinghe said today.
